node.title: Man arrested, woman facing extradition over alleged murder of toddler 30 years ago
node.alt: A man is escorted by three uniformed police officers.
node.description: A Porters Retreat man is arrested and a New Zealand woman is facing extradition over the alleged 1987 murder of a toddler in the NSW Central Tablelands.
node.content:
["A man has been arrested\u00a0and a New Zealand woman is facing extradition over the alleged murder of a two-year-old girl near Oberon, on the New South Wales Central Tablelands, more than 30 years ago.\u00a0", "Police first received information in 2019 that a child was fatally assaulted by a woman known to her in 1987 at a rural property at Porters Retreat, about 42km south of Oberon.", "Strike force Bertrand was then established.", "Investigations led homicide detectives to execute a crime scene warrant at a Porters Retreat home yesterday morning, which included a search of dams on the property by police divers.", "A 70-year-old man was arrested and taken to the Bathurst Police Station where he was charged with being an accessory after the fact to murder and misconduct offences in relation to a corpse.", "He was refused bail to appear before Bathurst local court today.", "", "
Divers searched the Porters Retreat property as part of a crime scene warrant yesterday.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "About the same time yesterday, police were granted an arrest warrant for a 59-year-old woman\u00a0living in Palmerston North City, New Zealand.", "She was arrested by New Zealand police.", "Police have applied for her extradition to Australia, which is currently before the courts in that country.", "Police allege the man assisted the woman with disposing of the toddler's remains after her death more than 30 years ago.", "", "
The Porters Retreat property was searched by police.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "
Hopes for justice for toddler and her family
", "Homicide Squad Commander, Detective Superintendent Danny Doherty said the arrest and extradition application would finally bring the opportunity for justice for the two-year-old.", "\"The level of violence allegedly used upon this child is abhorrent and left a father without his daughter or knowledge of her death for 34 years,\" he said.", "\"The NSW Police Force will always thoroughly investigate new information relating to historical crimes and have worked tirelessly to ensure justice is finally served for this little girl.\""]
